p: Meta‐regression models had low predictive power (CCSM3: pseudo‐ R 2 = 0.07; CSIRO: pseudo‐ R 2 = 0.09; UKMO: pseudo‐ R 2 = 0.12). IUCN categories of extinction risk, clutch size, and altitude midpoint (only for UKMO) were the main predictors of differences in species' range shifts (Table 2). The higher the risk of extinction the greater the reduction in range size under both CCSM3 and CSIRO climate models (Figure 2a,c). Further, species with larger clutch size tended to have lower reduction in range size under both CCSM3 and CSIRO (Figure 2b,d). Using UKMO, species occurring at higher altitudinal midpoint, extinction risk, and with larger clutch size had a lower reduction in range size (Figure 3).
